summary: This is an email chain between prosecutors and FBI agents regarding the collection and transfer of a pair of boots from a witness (M) in New Mexico to New York as evidence in the Ghislaine Maxwell case. The boots were reportedly bought for the witness by Jeffrey Epstein and Maxwell. The emails detail logistical coordination and note a legal hold due to a defense request for direct production.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: Subject of the criminal case; mentioned as having bought the boots for witness M along with Jeffrey Epstein.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Mentioned as having bought the boots for witness M along with Ghislaine Maxwell.

persons.name: Judge Nathan
persons.context: Judge presiding over the Maxwell case; the prosecution notes the defense has asked her to rule on whether the boots should be produced directly to them.

connections.description: Described together as having bought the boots for witness M.
Maxwell and Epstein are stated to have bought boots for M.
Epstein and Maxwell are stated to have bought boots for M.

events.title: Initial Request for Boot Collection
events.description: An AUSA emails the FBI requesting an agent in New Mexico pick up boots from witness M's house, as she has agreed to provide them as evidence.

events.title: Prosecution Requests Hold on Collection
events.description: Prosecution asks the FBI to hold off on collecting the boots because the defense has asked Judge Nathan to have the boots produced directly to them, pending a judicial ruling.

events.title: Court Resolves Boots Issue
events.description: An email states the Court has resolved issues around the boots, clearing the way for the FBI to collect and transfer them to New York.

events.title: Boots Picked Up in New Mexico
events.description: An FBI agent in New Mexico picks up the boots from the witness.

events.title: Boots Arrive in New York & Arrangements for Inspection
events.description: Emails confirm the boots have arrived in New York and arrangements are being made for both prosecution and defense to inspect them.

keyFacts: A witness (M) in New Mexico possessed boots that were bought for her by Jeffrey Epstein and Ghislaine Maxwell.
The boots were sought as physical evidence in the criminal case against Ghislaine Maxwell.
The defense sought to have the boots produced directly to them, bypassing the prosecution, leading to a temporary hold on collection pending a ruling from Judge Nathan.
The court later resolved the issue, allowing the FBI to collect the boots in June 2021 and transfer them to New York.
The email chain is a detailed record of inter-agency and prosecutorial coordination for evidence collection in a high-profile case.
